75BD797FFF6740FA8B69D810BCFD4A5C.description:
State that the Catholic Church works for the unity
of all people to live in peace and justice.

1AC56AADC1FC42B58DD7CB98E06835DA.description:
Show awareness that Native Americans identify
God as the Great Spirit.

53AEF1799BC04B728D6BB2ED967720F1.description: Name some of communions of Christian churches.

4EF0A701544847BB8C394D0DFC5842E0.description:
ECUMENISM AND DIALOGUE: Understand and participate in the call of the Church to be a sign of unity in the world through knowledge of and
collaboration with Christian churches, Jews, Muslims and all faith traditions.

8A5FBD1589F84277BE7AB30C2B545855.description:
Articulate that all people are called to holiness by
living their lives close to God.

71446BE5E10D478FA47C062127DEC17E.description:
Show understanding that parents have a vocation to
serve God and the Church by helping their children
to grow close to God.

45C4988B66D34124A42BA606D531185D.description:
State marriage, priesthood, religious life and single
life as special vocations in the Church.

E306183BB06F4F53BA1212A642098868.description: Describe vocation as a calling to serve others.

716571F0A7154C9F84155D84DC3896F1.description:
Show understanding that Jesus called people to be
his disciples.

E0C05810D76A4810A022628F0A2965F8.description:
Exhibit understanding that student desires to follow
Jesus.

2BFC1BF89A54437BACB86F2A9E3106D4.description:
VOCATION: Understand and undertake discipleship in Christ responding in faith by participating in the mission of the Church through living a
specific call in the life of the Church.

88D6D5D13F52469A9081ADD0438770C2.description: Identify the name of my parish.

634BA5690FAB4C6BB2DF50FD39C0CFD1.description:
Recognize that the parish is my church home where
I celebrate Mass, participate in the sacraments and
enjoy the companionship of other believers.

A8D401C1AC5C46A7A319312DFF549330.description:
PARISH LIFE: Understand and participate in the life of the Church as lived in the parish through its community, cultural aspects, worship,
sacramental life, service, missionary endeavors and organization.

2F87BF9555CA453D9E5801319236D2DB.description:
Explain that the Church continues the work of
Christ on earth.

EF10BD2933BD46BF9BBA283A6A9ACBE6.description:
Identify the birthday of the church as the feast of
Pentecost.

6F777B7AC9FA4D08BBF22BB73B51589E.description: Identify the bishops as successors to the apostles.

CC7777811C024AB98ECC08ED2376C2F8.description:
Name the Pope as the visible head of the Church on
earth.

CA7D57851E6A4F8BB998406E2D7F3996.description: State meaning of Communion of Saints.

ED1B3AE46B6B43AABF3FD14AA418D983.description:
Identify the apostles of Jesus as the ones who led
the early church communities.

B50D46BBC42F402AAAFDA4F77F304833.description:
State that Jesus Christ established the Church and is
its head and we are the body.

7296D6EFE43D47F9AEB8592769C5FF20.description:
Identify as a Christian who is a member of the
Catholic Church.

F95DA9C91CAD42B5B31FDEF3A2833510.description:
CATHOLIC CHURCH: Understand and appreciate the mystery of the Church, the body of Christ, the community of believers, as expressed in the
Church’s origin, mission of evangelization, hierarchical structure, marks, charisms, members and the communion of saints.

6E4C4628F1F141C182526179AFD424F6.description:
Identify the rosary as a special prayer using beads
and praying about the mysteries of Jesus’ life.

D4B3A60F5C5B4336A606A2CBE1A851A0.description:
Show understanding how use of scripture leads to
prayer.

3ACEC0A95B294A59A8E3CDF5299BD308.description: State that we pray with Mary and the saints.

AF0F7F49D1B34F7396B966B781714ACF.description:
Develop capacity of silence as a form of listening to
God within.

56C7B98454004DD5A7778E99389CA47A.description: Describe forms of prayer as public and private.

B21A88B9D14A47E9A0C6E7D1E6219DEE.description:
Exhibit understanding that the liturgy is a form of
prayer in which we worship God, and ask God for
whatever we need.

9DB5EE00189049A08222482E9C86D174.description:
Identify the Apostles Creed and Nicene Creed as
prayers of faith.

C2BEDE9EC90246779423686C7AAF3516.description:
Exhibit understanding that we can listen and talk to
God any time of day or night

18B76405A04E46B781A58FC2E7BEB006.description: State that prayer is necessary for the Christian life.

01C00FF0AB7742D8BDD2E301F94E2433.description:
Christian Prayer and Spirituality: Understand and express the different forms of prayer consciously recognizing the work of the Holy Spirit and the
meaning of self-surrender to God.

39DE8ACA2C7F43FB8A2E4C0999DBD908.description: Explain major seasons of the church year.

19CCE5743F1B4F52B88E5BDB2E18F769.description:
Describe the roles of the priest, deacon, lector,
ministers of Communion and acolytes in the Mass

C91093E92BB448208D4BAFA37DFFA699.description: Identify the symbols of the Eucharist.

9E5923524D7D4E91891A8B83D1AC38EA.description:
State that in the Concluding Rite we are blessed and
sent to serve others in the world.

CF84EFA2197847D298495BBBB8264FCD.description:
State that during the Introductory Rite of the Mass
we ask for forgiveness and praise God.

EFC6065FB7164B09B19AEB7A392ED11F.description: Identify parts of the Liturgy of the Eucharist.

0420780DD2C647DBA04618D73A365A45.description: Identify parts of the Liturgy of the Word

00F6B15E09734EA5B6F3B1CA3D6D049F.description:
Identify two major parts of the Mass: Liturgy of the
Word and Liturgy of the Eucharist.

5BF50E5CBC6549388F8800FA95D8F694.description:
LITURGY: Understand and celebrate the liturgical rites of the Church as expressed in the Church Year and epitomized in the Eucharist as the source
and summit of Christian life.

370DD0874FB140F0974E959B9DA4DB4F.description:
Identify the Our Father as the prayer of Jesus in the
Gospel of Matthew.

2A665727B8D54897AADA087D11365F03.description:
State meaning of kingdom of heaven by its use in
the Gospel of Matthew.

1F1F79BD5B144793BC9C93AE2CB04255.description:
Identify a parable of Jesus in the Gospel of
Matthew.

A88D91B6B742484EB042EE85750CCF95.description:
Identify Jesus as teacher and healer in the Gospel of
Matthew.

52F8BB45944F4027974C38F1B07BEFA2.description:
State New Testament as the stories and teachings of
Jesus Christ and the early church.

4ADDEFF91B6345858F1D0128EE523BC3.description: Identify Abraham as the father of our faith in God

70756F2993D04CD1B554D908A964E8D8.description:
Identify the Tower of Babel in the Book of Genesis
as a story about the beginning of cultures and
languages.

41879E22A82C4CA599ED7655DDF32564.description: Identify story of Noah and God’s promise to Noah.

E7C0D19771F34DEAA396E658ADB10B00.description:
Identify story of Cain and Abel as the sons of
Adam and Eve.

85BC9AB59674482BA5C62552B219BDC6.description:
State that the Old Testament books tell us about
God as Creator and Protector.

45265D0478B8496E874C2307141BD82B.description:
Identify first book of the Old Testament as the
Book of Genesis.

E6869D39AB8E4932A8F82EC1401ABC5C.description:
Name the Old Testament and New Testament as the
two major sections of the Bible

40291E185EF64C7AA9A45C6162B9D6F6.description:
State that the Holy Spirit inspired people to write
the Bible.

34692EBE481040B1BDEEE6195CC4B8CE.description:
Identify the Bible as a collection of books that
reveals God.

2C5CE0C522634F5FA85FEF6256CE8EC0.description: SACRED SCRIPTURE: Read, comprehend and articulate salvation history as conveyed in God’s revelation through the signs of scripture.

108AACA5B80F46ED807E3ECE6E88D011.description:
Identify how we live in a community of many races
and cultures.

D08B3FD90C404D81A6AB9A94A40631AC.description:
State meaning of virtue in relationship to the
Christian life.

264E92BA6F0F4930A39856927E645A1B.description:
Demonstrate understanding that we are responsible
stewards of creation.

38CF28EFD51146CF92B13F52253AD9F6.description: Describe how God made our bodies as sacred.

BD60A9B44C484F158C768A203FCF5E7B.description: Describe Jesus as showing us how to love

35D21415778D48D5B9F2558700AC1AAC.description:
Demonstrate understanding that the Two Great
Commandments encompass the Decalogue.

841E469A9D35480B8DD66C022A4731F5.description:
Show understanding that God gives us a free will so
that we might love, honor and obey God freely.

BFE620D4268145539B5137EC2D6880A5.description:
Exhibit understanding that God created us as
naturally good destined for union with God.

A0040F0525CF4897845EA6A740733FDB.description:
CHRISTIAN LIVING: Understand and live the moral teachings of the Church through a life of discipleship in Jesus Christ expressed in love for God,
positive self-image, personal integrity, social justice, the dignity of the human person and love of neighbor

5A133CE7BBB442FA9BCAF1732A6023E8.description: Identify Christian symbols of the Holy Spirit.

D8A2326A620A4ECE96544413ED075B04.description: Identify sacraments in service of communion.

479DE6E5423548A3982E4F738E9CEE02.description:
Connects the Blessed Sacrament with Christ’s
living presence under the forms of bread and wine.

AB3E219D6E3A4625A3D6BFD945FD6EC0.description:
Identify the Sacrament of Eucharist as the
sacrament of Christ’s presence in the Church.

4FF5C41A8B2940AC8EA076A132B1D63D.description:
Identify sacraments of initiation in the Christian
life.

75CD4DA109104F6A8CAA444A4BE727BE.description: Describe the sacraments as signs of God’s grace.

796E2FDE800D4945810EFC2CC43BDCCB.description:
SACRAMENTS: Understand and participate in the sacraments of the Church as efficacious signs of God’s grace, instituted by Christ and entrusted to
the Church.

E2D97CDE3EE64EACA9F6B6F6FE8AF3A4.description:
Exhibit understanding that we are meant for
heaven

63239D0BD2D7483B8D25080617A3DC89.description:
Recognize God as Judge who asks us to account for
how we obey his commands.

0A9229511BE0496A99CA371A6E11939B.description:
Identify that God’s Holy Spirit lives in me and
inspires me to do what is good.

9DAA4B68DC39443A8C462BF98310EB95.description:
Identify that God’s Holy Spirit lives in me and
inspires me to do what is good.

8F3E160C204041EAAD192F0610B7BD6C.description: Identify Jesus Christ as Savior and Redeemer

EDFE60B5E82A48B2A502DC31D89BA036.description:
Exhibit how God wants our love as a response to
his love

6BDBAD6AF8634908B67FB18E192A5F02.description:
Demonstrate understanding that God the Father
loves us as a good and loving parent.

BD574C492F0B44B38EA9656377D332F5.description:
State understanding of meaning when we say, “I
believe in one God.”

8F3637100D1748C196922B9790FC5701.description: Identify the Holy Trinity in the Apostles Creed.

47A106B0BC7B4B55B7ED178364AC3646.description:
CREED: Understand, believe and proclaim the Triune God as revealed in the signs of creation, Sacred Scripture, Catholic Tradition and human
experience.
